title: Mick Hucknall denies having sex with 3,000 women in heyday
text:
Mick hasn’t been keeping track of his number (Picture: Lorne Thomson/Redferns)

Mick Hucknall has denied having sex with 3,000 women in three years – but doesn’t actually know his ‘number’.

The Simply Red frontman dated a string of famous women at the height of his fame, including Catherine Zeta Jones, Helena Christensen and Martine McCutcheon, and in 2010, did an infamous interview where he claimed he had sex with three women a day.

He told the Guardian: ‘When I had the fame, it went crazy. Between 1985-1987, I would sleep with about three women a day, every day. I never said no.

‘This was what I wanted from being a pop star. I was living the dream and my only regret is that I hurt some really good girls.’

Mick dated Catherine Zeta Jones… (Picture: Alberto Roveri/Mondadori via Getty Images)

… and Ulrika Jonsson… (Picture: Dave Benett/Getty Images)

However, Mick – who is now happily married to Gabriella Wesberry – has insisted the numbers were blown out of proportion.

The 59-year-old told the Times: ‘I had said, “In the crazy days, it was screaming girls everywhere and it felt like you were sleeping with three women a day.” It wasn’t literally that.’

When asked about the real numbers, the Fairground singer said: ‘I have no idea. I don’t put chips on the bedposts. I haven’t a clue, and have never thought about calculating.

‘Anybody who knows me knows that I do not treat or talk about women like that, not even among friends in pubs.’

… and Martine McCutcheon (Picture: Dave Benett/Getty Images)

Mick is happily married (Picture: David M Benett/Dave Benett/Getty Images)

The star added that he doesn’t miss his womanising days ‘one bit’.

Mick – known for his trademark curly red hair – was linked to a host of stars over the years, including Martine, Helena, Catherine, Ulrika Jonsson, Brigitte Nielsen and Alicia Douvall.

However, he has since found true love with wife Gabriella, who he reunited with in 2002 after previously dating in the 90s.

The couple married in 2010, three years after welcoming their daughter Romy.

Simply Red have sold over 50 million albums worldwide and had huge success with songs including Holding Back The Years, Stars and Fairground.

The band is set to release their 12th studio album, Blue Eyed Soul, in November.
